title: Genetic, clinical underpinnings of subtle early brain change along Alzheimer’s dimensions
brief: It is shown that manifestations of brain changes in early asymptomatic stages can be detected via a novel deep semi-supervised representation learning method and deepen the understanding of the multifaceted pathogenesis of AD beyond the brain.
authors: J. Wen; Zhijian Yang; I. Nasrallah; Yuhan Cui; G. Erus; D. Srinivasan; A. Abdulkadir; E. Mamourian; G. Hwang; Ashutosh Kumar Singh; M. Bergman; J. Bao; E. Varol; Zhen Zhou; Aleix Boquet-Pujadas; Jiong Chen; A. Toga; A. Saykin; T. Hohman; P. Thompson; S. Villeneuve; R. Gollub; A. Sotiras; K. Wittfeld; H. Grabe; D. Tosun; M. Bilgel; Y. An; D. Marcus; Pamela J. LaMontagne; S. Heckbert; T. Austin; L. Launer; Mark Espeland; C. Masters; P. Maruff; J. Fripp; S. Johnson; J. Morris; M. Albert; R. Bryan; S. Resnick; L. Ferrucci; Yong Fan; M. Habes; D. Wolk; Li Shen; H. Shou; C. Davatzikos

title: Signs and symptoms associated with a need for supervision in patients with Alzheimer's disease
brief: Clinicians and caregivers can aid clinicians and caregivers in prognosis and planning, suggest symptoms to target with non-pharmacological and pharmacological treatments to forestall this important functional milestone, and suggest priorities for future research.
authors: C. C. Huey; A. Kociolek; K. Fernandez; M. Hernandez; R. Gottesman; M. Barker; S. Cosentino; Y. Stern

title: A multimodal intervention for Alzheimer's disease results in multifaceted systemic effects reflected in blood and ameliorates functional and cognitive outcomes
authors: J. Roach; L. Edens; D. R. Markewych; M. Rapozo; J. Hara; Gustavo Glusman; C. Funk; J. Bramen; P. Baloni; W. Shankle; L. Hood

title: Amyloid and Tau Pathology are Associated with Cerebral Blood Flow in Nondemented Older Adults with and without Vascular Risk Factors for Alzheimer's Disease
authors: C. G. Swinford; S. Risacher; A. Vosmeier; R. Deardorff; E. Chumin; M. Dzemidzic; Y.-C. Wu; S. Gao; B. McDonald; K. Yoder; F. Unverzagt; S. Wang; M. Farlow; J. Brosch; D. Clark; L. Apostolova; J. Sims; D. J. Wang; A. Saykin

title: Naturally occurring Alzheimer’s disease in rhesus monkeys
authors: Zhenhui Li; Xiaping He; Shihao Wu; Rongyao Huang; Hao Li; Zhengbo Wang; Limin Wang; Dongdong Qin; Yu Kong; Yingqi Guo; Xia Ma; C. Turck; Zhiqi Xiong; Wenchao Wang; Xintian Hu

title: Optimal combinations of CSF biomarkers for predicting cognitive decline and clinical conversion in cognitively unimpaired participants and mild cognitive impairment patients: A multi-cohort study
brief: P-tau/A{beta}42 is sufficient for predicting progression in AD, with very high accuracy, and adding NfL improves the prediction of all-cause dementia conversion and cognitive decline.
authors: G. Salvadó; V. Larsson; K. Cody; N. Cullen; E. Jonaitis; E. Stomrud; G. Kollmorgen; N. Wild; S. Palmqvist; S. Janelidze; N. Mattsson-Carlgren; H. Zetterberg; K. Blennow; S. Johnson; R. Ossenkoppele; O. Hansson

title: Association between Serum Biomarker Profile and Real-World Evidence of Disability in Multiple Sclerosis
brief: Serumprotein biomarker profiles improve the prediction of real-world MS disability status beyond clinical profile alone or clinical profile plus individual protein biomarker, reaching clinically actionable performance.
authors: W. Zhu; C. Chen; L. Zhang; T. Hoyt; E. Walker; S. Venkatesh; F. Zhang; F. Qureshi; J. Foley; Z. Xia

title: Plasma phosphorylated tau 181 predicts amyloid status and conversion from mild cognitive impairment to dementia stage; major impact of renal function on diagnostic performance in the BALTAZAR cohort
brief: Chronic kidney disease, creatinine and glomerular filtration rate were independently associated with plasma P-tau181 concentrations, thereby altering the optimal cutpoints for A{beta}+ or conversion to dementia detection, making this blood biomarker central to AD management.
authors: S. Lehmann; S. Schraen-Maschke; J. Vidal; C. Delaby; F. Blanc; C. Paquet; B. Allinquant; S. Bombois; A. Gabelle; O. Hanon

title: Associations between affective/vegetative neuropsychiatric symptoms and brain morphology in aging people with mild cognitive impairment and Alzheimer's disease.
brief: Findings show the implication of fronto-temporal regions with sleep disorders, depression and appetite changes, and contribute to a better understanding of brain morphological differences between CN, MCI and AD with respect to all five NPS.
authors: A. Cannizzaro; L. Ronat; L. M. El Haffaf; A. Hanganu

title: Statistical Evaluation of the Test Threshold for the Alzheimer's Disease EEG Coherence Marker
brief: If synaptic disconnection as the neuropathology of Alzheimer's disease (AD) is responsible for the brain's inability to integrate diverse regions into efficient networks, then electroencephalographic data may be utilized to identify Alzheimer's dementia.
authors: C. Radinski; G. Perez

title: What does heritability of Alzheimer’s disease represent?
brief: Estimates of heritability in Alzheimer’s disease, the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by genetics, are very varied across different studies, therefore, the amount of ‘missing’ heritability not yet captured by current genome-wide association studies is debated.
authors: E. Baker; G. Leonenko; K. Schmidt; M. Hill; A. Myers; M. Shoai; I. de Rojas; N. Tesi; H. Holstege; W. M. van der Flier; Y. Pijnenburg; A. Ruiz; J. Hardy; S. J. van der Lee; V. Escott-Price

title: Exploration of cortical Î²-Amyloid load in Alzheimer's disease using quantitative susceptibility mapping at 9.4T
brief: This explorative study points toward the development of more accessible clinical methods to non-invasively detect effects of A{beta} accumulation in AD patients by exploring cortical features that can be detected by ultra-high field QSM at different spatial resolutions.
authors: E. Tuzzi; A. Loktyushin; A. Zeller; R. Pohmann; C. Laske; K. Scheffler; G. Hagberg

title: Biological age and brain age in midlife: relationship to multimorbidity and mental health
brief: This study investigates whether elevated biological age and accelerated brain age are associated with an increased risk of multimorbidity using a large dataset from the Midlife in the United States (MIDUS) Refresher study and presents the first effort to test whether sex moderates the relationship between these surrogate aging biomarkers and multimOrbidity.
authors: Fengqing Zhang; Hansoo Chang; S. Schaefer; J. Gou

title: Hierarchical Two-Stage Cost-Sensitive Clinical Decision Support System for Screening Prodromal Alzheimer's Disease and Related Dementias
brief: The primary stage is brief and effective at screening, with the optional two- stage technique further increasing specificity, and the hierarchical two-stage technique exhibited similar accuracy but with reduced costs compared to the more common single-stage paradigm.
authors: M. Kleiman; T. Ariko; J. Galvin

title: Age-specific activation of microglial genes in a mouse model of AD
authors: Haoyang Zhou; Yizhou Yu

title: Gut inflammation associated with age and Alzheimer's disease pathology
brief: Calprotectin levels are higher with age, and that higher calprotectin was associated with greater amyloid burden among participants with an amyloids-confirmed AD dementia diagnosis, suggesting that intestinal inflammation may play a role in pathology development and that it may exacerbate the progression toward AD.
authors: M. Heston; K. Hanslik; K. Zarbock; S. Harding; N. Davenport-Sis; R. Kerby; N. Chin; Y. Sun; A. Hoeft; Y. Deming; N. Vogt; T. Betthauser; S. Johnson; S. Asthana; G. Kollmorgen; I. Suridjan; N. Wild; H. Zetterberg; K. Blennow; F. Rey; B. Bendlin; T. Ulland

title: Association between cancer and dementia risk in the UK Biobank: evidence of diagnostic bias
brief: Investigation of the UK Biobank to generate and compare estimates for the cancer-dementia association using different analytical specifications designed to address different sources of bias found incident cancer diagnoses were associated with a higher risk of subsequent dementia diagnoses.
authors: J. Wang; P. Buto; S. Ackley; L. Kobayashi; R. E. Graff; S. Zimmerman; S. Asiimwe; C. Calmasini; M. Glymour

title: Menopause, Brain Anatomy, Cognition and Alzheimer’s Disease
brief: It is confirmed that both early and surgical menopause are associated with a higher risk of developing AD, indicating that early and abrupt ovarian hormone deprivation might contribute to the development of the disorder.
authors: M. Costantino; Grace Pigeau; Olivier Parent; Justine Ziolkowski; Gabriel A. Devenyi; N. Gervais; M. Mallar Chakravarty

title: Virtual histology of Alzheimer’s Disease: why are amyloid-β plaques visible with X-ray phase-contrast imaging?
brief: The fibrillar and elemental compositions of Aβ plaques in brain samples from different types of AD patients and different AD animal models were probed to establish a relationship between XPCT contrast and Aβ plaque characteristics and the hypothesis that the Aβ–related contrast in XPCT could be caused by the A β fibrils and/or by metal entrapment within the Aα plaques was tested.
authors: Matthieu Chourrout; C. Sandt; T. Weitkamp; T. Dučić; D. Meyronet; T. Baron; J. Klohs; Nicolas Rama; H. Boutin; Shifali Singh; C. Olivier; M. Wiart; E. Brun; S. Bohic; F. Chauveau

title: Synthesizing Images of Tau Pathology from Cross-modal Neuroimaging using Deep Learning
brief: A convolutional neural network model is presented that can impute tau PET images with high accuracy and suggests that extending neuroimaging’s use with artificial intelligence to predict protein specific pathologies has great potential to inform emerging care models.
authors: Jeyeon Lee; B. Burkett; Hoon-Ki Min; M. Senjem; Ellen Dicks; Nick Corriveau-Lecavalier; Carly T. Mester; H. Wiste; E. Lundt; M. Murray; A. Nguyen; R. Reichard; H. Botha; J. Graff‐Radford; L. Barnard; J. Gunter; C. Schwarz; K. Kantarci; D. Knopman; B. Boeve; V. Lowe; R. Petersen; C. Jack; David T. Jones

title: Cerebrospinal fluid neurofilament light improves accurate distinction between neurodegenerative and psychiatric disorders at a cognitive neuropsychiatry service
brief: Cerebrospinal fluid neurofilament light improved diagnostic accuracy, with potential to have led to earlier, accurate diagnosis in a real-world setting using a pre-specified cut-off, adding weight to translation of NfL into clinical practice.
authors: M. Kang; D. Eratne; H. Dobson; C. Malpas; M. Keem; C. Lewis; J. Grewal; V. Tsoukra; C. Dang; R. Mocellin; T. Kalincik; A. Santillo; H. Zetterberg; K. Blennow; C. Stehmann; S. Varghese; Q.-X. Li; C. Masters; S. Collins; S. Berkovic; A. Evans; W. Kelso; S. Farrand; S. Loi; M. Walterfang; D. Velakoulis

title: Biological aging of human body and brain systems
brief: It is found that an organ's biological age selectively influences the aging of other organ systems, revealing a multiorgan aging network and revealing the multisystem nature of human aging.
authors: Y. Tian; V. Cropley; A. Maier; N. Lautenschlager; M. Breakspear; A. Zalesky

title: Feasibility of linking markers of dementia-related health in primary care medical records to cognitive function assessed in a specialist dementia service
brief: This feasibility study highlights the challenges in obtaining consent and linking primary and secondary care EHR in dementia, and in extracting cognitive function scores from dementia service EHR.
authors: M. Marshall; P. Campbell; J. Bailey; C. Chew‐Graham; P. Croft; M. Frisher; R. Hayward; R. Negi; T. Rathod-Mistry; S. Singh; L. Robinson; A. Sumathipala; N. Thein; K. Walters; S. Weich; K. Jordan

title: A spatiotemporal map of the aging mouse brain reveals white matter tracts as vulnerable foci
brief: It is revealed that glia aging is profoundly accelerated in white matter compared to cortical areas, and distinct clusters of brain regions that differentially express genes associated with 3 human neurodegenerative diseases are discovered, highlighting regional aging as a potential modulator of disease.
authors: Oliver Hahn; Aulden G. Foltz; Micaiah Atkins; Blen Kedir; Patricia Moran-Losada; Ian H. Guldner; Christy Munson; Fabian Kern; Róbert Pálovics; Nannan Lu; Achint Kaur; Jacob Hull; J. Huguenard; Andreas Keller; B. Lehallier; T. Wyss-Coray
